titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Nancy Sahli gay rights, Capitol Hill N.O.W, and related Washingtoniana papers, 1974-1978 MS2386

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Nancy Sahli gay rights, Capitol Hill N.O.W, and related Washingtoniana papers
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: Donated by historian and archivist Nancy Sahli, this collection contains fliers, newsletters, articles, letters, postcards, and programs. These materials cover several diverse topics all under the overall subject of the history of Washington DC. These topics include women's rights including records of the Capitol Hill National Organization for Women (NOW) and the Sexuality Task Force, a sub-unit of the D.C. NOW chapter, as well as gay rights topics from Title 34 (D.C.'s law against discriminiation), National Gay Task Force, and materials related to the fight for gay rights in Dade County, Florida. The collection also incudes postcards and stereocards of d.c. sites and landmarks as well as a folder for local music programs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be governed by copyright. For activities that the researcher determines fall under fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights, determining if the intended re-use falls under fair use, and obtaining approval from the copyright holder if the intended use does not fall under fair use. Please contact Special Collections if the copyright status of the materials you wish to reuse is unclear. Staff will provide additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folder titles supplied by the donor. Arranged in no particular order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: MS2204: National Organization for Women Washington D.C. Chapter and Capitol Hill Chapter records https://searcharchives.library.gwu.edu/repositories/2/resources/358

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains fliers, newsletters, articles, letters, postcards, and programs. These materials cover several diverse topics all under the overall subject of the history of Washington DC. These topics include women's rights including records of the Capitol Hill National Organization for Women (NOW) and the Sexuality Task Force, a sub-unit of the D.C. NOW chapter, as well as gay rights topics from Title 34 (D.C.'s law against discriminiation), National Gay Task Force, and materials related to the fight for gay rights in Dade County, Florida. The collection also incudes postcards and stereocards of d.c. sites and landmarks as well as a folder with programs for local music groups and events including The Washington Consort, Washington Bach Festival, The 20th Century Consort, The University of Maryland Chorus, The Choral Arts Society of Washington, and The Capitol Hill Arts Workshop. Many of these events place primarily at churches in the city.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nancy Sahli served for 20 years on the staff of National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC) in a variety of roles incuding archivist, a Grants Analyst, Director of the Records Program, Program Director, and Acting Executive Director. The NHPRC is the grant-making arm of the National Archives and Records Administration. Her articles related to archives have been published in the American Archivist and the Midwestern Archivist and include topics such as finding aids, and the format standard USMARC Archival and Manuscripts Control (AMC). Dr. Sahli is a fellow of the Society of American Archivists (SAA) which is one of the highest honors bestowed on individuals by SAA and is awarded for outstanding contributions to the archives profession. Dr. Sahli received her PhD from the University of Pennsylvania in 1974. The title of her dissertation is Elizabeth Blackwell, MD (1821-1910): a biography.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The music programs primarily took place in Washington DC churches and included programs for the Washington Consort, Trinity College Department of Music, The Choral Arts Society of Washington, and the Cathedral Choral Society. Also included is one theater program for the Mutual Theatre "Washington's finest burlesque house" for a production of The Bobbed-Hair Brandits. The folder also holds one map published by Rand McNally as part of the Haskin Information Bureau.
